Psychology_430_p$Psychology_66_p$Psychol.text:
Finding A: Participation in a choir or other group activity can increase their level of social interaction and potentially provide an additional social identity, which could have positive outcomes for their health and well being.
Finding B: The effect of bundling was magnified among the participants restricted to the self-service condition: 20.7% bought large drinks in the bundled condition, compared with 37.1% in the typical-portion condition, χ 2 (1, N = 179) = 5.72, p = .02.
Finding C: While overactivity was attenuated by levetiracetam in aMCI cohorts treated with low doses (62.5 and 125 mg BID), decreased EC activation was concurrently normalized, with a significant boost in EC activation at the 62.5 mg BID dose compared to placebo.
Finding D: Results: With a total of 4986 ASD cases, our study showed that regardless of cultural background circumcised boys were more likely than intact boys to develop ASD before age 10 years (HR ¼ 1.46; 95% CI: 1.11-1.93).
Psychology_430_p$Psychology_66_p$Psychol.displayed_text:
Finding A: Participation in a choir or other group activity can increase their level of social interaction and potentially provide an additional social identity, which could have positive outcomes for their health and well being.
Finding B: The effect of bundling was magnified among the participants restricted to the self-service condition: 20.7% bought large drinks in the bundled condition, compared with 37.1% in the typical-portion condition, χ 2 (1, N = 179) = 5.72, p = .02.
Finding C: While overactivity was attenuated by levetiracetam in aMCI cohorts treated with low doses (62.5 and 125 mg BID), decreased EC activation was concurrently normalized, with a significant boost in EC activation at the 62.5 mg BID dose compared to placebo.
Finding D: Results: With a total of 4986 ASD cases, our study showed that regardless of cultural background circumcised boys were more likely than intact boys to develop ASD before age 10 years (HR ¼ 1.46; 95% CI: 1.11-1.93).

Psychology_462_p$Psychology_423_p$Psycho.text:
Finding A: Low self-esteem made the largest contribution to the variance, followed by high levels of perfectionism, body dissatisfaction, and symptoms of anxiety (see Table 4 ).
Finding B: There was also a significant effect of Spoon Weight on the perceived expensiveness of the yoghurt (F 1,34 = 4.413, P = .043, eta 2 p = .115, see Figure 1b ).
Finding C: Re-exposure to Dutch words during sleep improved later memory for the German translation of the cued words when compared with uncued words.
Finding D: Here, insula patients distributed their choices between the two color options, and showed no apparent differences in basic \'stickiness\' or self-reported confidence, but they deviated from the other groups in that they did not show a gambler\'s fallacy bias.

Finding A: Low self-esteem made the largest contribution to the variance, followed by high levels of perfectionism, body dissatisfaction, and symptoms of anxiety (see Table 4 ).
Finding B: There was also a significant effect of Spoon Weight on the perceived expensiveness of the yoghurt (F 1,34 = 4.413, P = .043, eta 2 p = .115, see Figure 1b ).
Finding C: Re-exposure to Dutch words during sleep improved later memory for the German translation of the cued words when compared with uncued words.
Finding D: Here, insula patients distributed their choices between the two color options, and showed no apparent differences in basic \'stickiness\' or self-reported confidence, but they deviated from the other groups in that they did not show a gambler\'s fallacy bias.

Psychology_24_p$Psychology_tweet_76_p$Ps.text:
Finding A: The brain areas with increased functional connectivity associated with both sleep and Depressive Problems scores included the lateral orbitofrontal cortex, dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, anterior and posterior cingulate cortices, insula, parahippocampal gyrus, hippocampus, amygdala, temporal cortex, and precuneus.
Finding B: These findings provides a neural basis for understanding how depression is associated with poor sleep quality, and this in turn has implications for treatment because of the brain areas identified.
Finding C: Notably, here too with emotional memories, we found a significant association between ΔRecall nap and ΔRecall overnight such that declines in accuracy across the nap were associated with improvements across overnight sleep (B = −0.488, p = 0.029; 95% CI: [−1.294, −0.079]; Fig.
Finding D: Men over-state, while women under-state, drunkenness: their own and other peoples\' In a college student sample. Hmmm.

Psychology_400_p$Psychology_tweet_59_p$P.text:
Finding A: Thus, irrespective of whether infants had to initiate a saccadic eye movement to a single item or to a stimulus item in the presence of a competing item, those who were delivered by caesarean section took longer to allocate attention and initiate that eye movement than did those who were delivered vaginally.
Finding B: Across most samples and in a meta-analysis, lower neuroticism and higher extraversion, conscientiousness, and openness at baseline were prospectively related to faster gait speed.
Finding C: They could even see that the lags in connection development with the two task-related networks -- the frontoparietal and ventral attention networks -- were located primarily in two specific areas of the brain.
Finding D: These findings indicate that in modern-day dating contexts, in which initial attraction often is determined by a rapid decision following a brief interaction or seeing a photograph, displays of expansive posture increase one\'s chances of initial romantic success.
Psychology_400_p$Psychology_tweet_59_p$P.displayed_text:
Finding A: Thus, irrespective of whether infants had to initiate a saccadic eye movement to a single item or to a stimulus item in the presence of a competing item, those who were delivered by caesarean section took longer to allocate attention and initiate that eye movement than did those who were delivered vaginally.
Finding B: Across most samples and in a meta-analysis, lower neuroticism and higher extraversion, conscientiousness, and openness at baseline were prospectively related to faster gait speed.
Finding C: They could even see that the lags in connection development with the two task-related networks -- the frontoparietal and ventral attention networks -- were located primarily in two specific areas of the brain.
Finding D: These findings indicate that in modern-day dating contexts, in which initial attraction often is determined by a rapid decision following a brief interaction or seeing a photograph, displays of expansive posture increase one\'s chances of initial romantic success.

Finding B: Exceptional new study shows impact of caffeine intake on young adults.

Psychology_146_r$Psychology_230_p$Psycho.text:
Finding A: An innovative brain imaging study has uncovered new evidence explaining why ToM deficiencies are present in ASD children.
Finding B: Given that ΔRecall nap significantly predicted ΔRecall overnight , and both significantly predicted by nap SWA, the preliminary conditions for a mediation analysis were met.
Finding C: Participation in a choir or other group activity can increase their level of social interaction and potentially provide an additional social identity, which could have positive outcomes for their health and well being.
Finding D: The attenuated responses to MP, including reduced decreases in striatal DVs, are consistent with decreased brain reactivity to the DA stimulation in marijuana abusers that might contribute to their negative emotionality (increased stress reactivity and irritability) and addictive behaviors.

Psychology_373_r$Psychology_26_r$Psychol.text:
Finding A: Self-efficacy and support The result: support from their partners is helpful to smokers who wish to stop and it increases their chances of success, provided that they have developed skills of their own that help them to abstain.
Finding B: The researchers conclude that increased functional connectivity among these brain regions provides a neural basis for how depression is related to poor sleep quality.
Finding C: When the Going Gets Tough: The "Why” of Goal Striving Matters. An excellent article by @username + colleagues.
Finding D: Older adults who were widowed who volunteered about 100 hours a year reduced their risk of loneliness to those who were married. Results suggest having new social networks can notably reduce the risk of loneliness among people who are widowed.

Psychology_510_p$Psychology_42_p$Psychol.text:
Finding A: Our results showed that most of the official adult-onset men began their antisocial activities during early childhood.
Finding B: Importantly, we observe that happiness increases before birth, suggesting that the happiness gain around the time of birth may capture not only the effect of the birth but also the complex childbearing process that may involve partnership formation, partnership quality, and increased sexual activity.
Finding C: Regardless of background, the team explains, "circumcised boys were more likely than intact boys to develop ASD before age 10 years."
Finding D: A total of 162 functional connectivity links involving areas associated with sleep, such as the precuneus, anterior cingulate cortex, and the lateral orbitofrontal cortex, were identified.
